ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Instrument vs. melee attacks
ygData.msgSnippet: GZ stated in the Arch-Magi answers that instruments only increase the primary effect(s) of songs, not the range :( Rokenn
ygData.messageBody:
GZ stated in the Arch-Magi answers that instruments only increase the
primary effect(s) of songs, not the range :(

Rokenn

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kenneth E. Bachman [mailto:kbachman@...]
> Sent: Friday, April 07, 2000 7:33 AM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Instrument vs. melee attacks
>
>
> I'm curious whether anyone has done the same thing for our
> travel songs (speed, underwater, levitate,
> invis). And if anyone has checked whether the RADIUS of the
> songs increase if instruments are used?
>
> Kenross Cantoforjado, 47 songs, Innoruuk
>
>
>
> Sylly Songsynger wrote:
>
> > It might be worth while to analyse AE more closely. For
> the past 10+
> > levels, I am concerned with keeping my clerics and casters
> in AE for mana
> > song and spend time in outside views watching for the
> sparkles. It might be
> > worth while to get a friend - ungrouped and test the actual
> AE radius for
> > your dmg songs. One might find that you can use them with
> the dreaded
> > enchanters - as long as you can not wake up the sleeping
> mobs. And maybe
> > bards can do this once you understand the AE radius well.
> Also, this
> > presumes that we want to do this (ie your songs will do
> more dmg that your
> > weps.)
> >
> > Sylly
>
>
